H0.text: The environment has changed is a conclusion best supported by the fossil record that shows trees have changed throughout the years.

H1.text: Animals need leafy trees is the conclusion best supported by the fossil record, which shows that trees have changed throughout the years.

H2.text: Rocks can destroy trees is the conclusion best supported by the fossil record that shows trees have changed throughout the years.

H3.text: Trees give off oxygen, a conclusion best supported by the fossil record showing that trees have changed throughout the years.

A4.text: Widespread coal swamp deposits across North America and Europe during the Carboniferous Period contain a wealth of fossils containing arborescent lycopods up to 30 m tall, abundant seed plants, such as conifers and seed ferns, and countless smaller, herbaceous plants.

A5.text: Angiosperms (flowering plants) evolved during the Mesozoic, and flowering plant pollen and leaves first appeared during the Early Cretaceous, approximately 130 million years ago.
